s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT ENGINE MOUNTING BRACKET LH

s2.ptxt: Install the mounting bracket with the 4 bolts.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT ENGINE MOUNTING BRACKET RH

s2.ptxt: Install the mounting bracket with the 4 bolts.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL CAMSHAFT TIMING OIL CONTROL VALVE

s2.ptxt: Apply a coat of engine oil to a new O-ring.
Install the O-ring to the oil control valve.
Install the oil control valve with the bolt.
Apply a light coat of engine oil to the O-ring of the sensor.
Install the sensor with the bolt.
Install the connector to the connector bracket.
Attach the harness clamp.
Connect the sensor connector.
Apply a coat of engine oil to a new O-ring.
Install the O-ring to the sensor.
Install the sensor with the bolt.
Using a 19 mm deep socket wrench, install a new gasket and the sensor.
Install the sensor so that it is horizontal as shown in the illustration. Then install the bolt.

atten4.ptxt: It is acceptable for the sensor to be tilted +-10°.

s2.ptxt: Connect the sensor connector.
Install a new gasket and the No. 1 water by-pass pipe with the 2 nuts and bolt.
Apply adhesive to 2 or 3 threads of the oil pressure switch.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota genuine adhesive 1344, three bond 1344 or equivalent

s2.ptxt: Install the oil pressure switch.

atten3.ptxt: Do not start the engine for at least 1 hour after the installation of the switch.

s2.ptxt: Connect the oil pressure switch connector.
Start the engine and check for engine oil leaks.
Install the spacer, idler pulley and pulley plate with the bolt.
Install a new gasket to the thermostat.

atten4.ptxt: When installing the thermostat to the gasket, be careful not to deform the gasket. Make sure that the thermostat is properly installed into the groove of the gasket, as shown in the illustration.

s2.ptxt: Insert the thermostat into the cylinder block with the jiggle valve facing straight upward.

atten4.ptxt: The jiggle valve may be set within 10° of either side of the prescribed position.

s2.ptxt: Install the inlet with the 2 nuts and bolt.
Connect the connector.
Temporarily install the belt tensioner with the 3 bolts.

atten4.ptxt: Make sure the flanges of the bolts are contacting the tensioner surface.

s2.ptxt: Install the tensioner by tightening the 3 bolts in the order shown in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: Install the No. 1 compressor mounting bracket exactly as described in the procedures below to properly secure and prevent damage to the fan and generator V belt.

s2.ptxt: Temporarily install the No. 1 compressor mounting bracket with the 3 bolts.

atten4.ptxt: Temporarily install the No. 1 compressor mounting bracket with the 3 bolts so that the bracket can be moved by hand.

s2.ptxt: Push the No. 1 compressor mounting bracket toward the cylinder block as shown in the illustration and tighten bolt B.

atten4.ptxt: Make sure there is no clearance between the cylinder block and No. 1 compressor mounting bracket as shown in the illustration.

s2.ptxt: Uniformly tighten the 4 bolts in the order shown in the illustration.
Temporarily install the idle pulley assembly with the bolt.
Tighten the bolt.
Install a new gasket and the exhaust manifold with the 6 nuts.
Install the heat insulator with the 5 bolts.
Install a new gasket and the intake manifold with the 5 bolts and 2 nuts.
Connect the crankshaft position sensor to the clamp.
Install a new insulator to the injector.
Apply a light coat of grease or gasoline to a new O-ring and install it to the injector.
Apply a light coat of grease or gasoline on the place where the delivery pipe touches the O-ring.
To install the fuel injector into the fuel delivery pipe, push the fuel injector while twisting it right and left.

item.ptxt: Be careful not to twist the O-ring.
After installing the fuel injector, check that it turns smoothly. If not, reinstall it with a new O-ring.

s2.ptxt: Position the injector connector so that it faces downward.
Install the 4 spacers to the cylinder head.
Install the delivery pipe together with the 4 injectors and 2 spacers with the 2 bolts.
Connect the 4 injector connectors.
Connect the 4 clamps and wire harness to the delivery pipe.
Connect the vacuum hose.
Install a new gasket on the intake manifold.

atten4.ptxt: Align the protrusion of the gasket with the groove of the intake manifold.

s2.ptxt: Install the throttle body with the 4 bolts.
Connect the 2 water by-pass hoses to the throttle body.
Connector the throttle position sensor and control motor connector.
Connect the wire harness (engine ground wire) to the engine rear side with the 2 bolts so that it is within the specified range shown in the illustration.
Connect the oil pressure sensor connector.
Connect the noise filter connector.
Connect the camshaft position sensor connector.
Connect the 4 injector connectors.
Connect the crankshaft position sensor connector.
Connect the oil control valve connector.
Connect the purge VSV connector.
Connect the throttle body connector.
Connect the engine coolant temperature sensor connector.
Connect the knock sensor connector.
Connect the wire harness to the clamps.
Install the generator with the 2 bolts.
Install the generator wire with the bolt and nut.
Attach the terminal cap.
Connect the connector.
Install the ventilation pipe with the bolt.
Using a 16 mm spark plug wrench, install the 4 spark plugs.
Install the ignition coil with the bolt.
Connect the 4 ignition coil connectors.
Attach the engine sling device and chain block to the engine hangers.
Slowly lower the engine assembly into the engine compartment.
Install the engine mounting brackets with the 4 bolts and 4 nuts.
Install the end plate with the 2 bolts.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL DRIVE PLATE AND RING GEAR SUB-ASSEMBLY (for Automatic Transmission)

atten4.ptxt: If any of the mounting bolts is broken or deformed, replace it.

s2.ptxt: Apply adhesive to 2 or 3 threads of the mounting bolt end.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota Genuine Adhesive 1324, Three Bond 1324 or equivalent

s2.ptxt: Install the drive plate.
Fix the crankshaft in place with SST.
Install and uniformly tighten the 10 mounting bolts in several passes in the order shown in the illustration.
If any of the mounting bolts does not meet the torque specification, replace the mounting bolts.

item.ptxt: The mounting bolts are tightened in 2 progressive steps.
If any of the mounting bolts is broken or deformed, replace it.

s2.ptxt: Apply adhesive to 2 or 3 threads of the mounting bolt end.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota Genuine Adhesive 1324, Three Bond 1324 or Equivalent

s2.ptxt: Install the flywheel.
Fix the crankshaft in place with SST.
Install and uniformly tighten the 10 mounting bolts in several passes in the order shown in the illustration.
If any of the mounting bolts does not meet the torque specification, replace the mounting bolts.
Mark the mounting bolts with paint.
Retighten the mounting bolts by 90° in the numerical order shown in the illustration.
Check that the painted marks are now at a 90° angle to the previous position.
Insert SST into the clutch disc. Then insert SST (together with the clutch disc) into the flywheel.

atten3.ptxt: Make sure not to insert the clutch disc facing the wrong direction.

s2.ptxt: Align the matchmarks on the clutch cover and flywheel.
Loosely install the 6 bolts.
Tighten the 6 bolts as described below.

s3.ptxt: Determine the first bolt to be tightened by choosing the bolt closest to the knock pin.
Uniformly tighten the 6 bolts in diametrically opposite pairs relative to the position of the first bolt. Use the illustration as a reference.

s2.ptxt: Lightly move SST up and down, and right and left.
Check that the disc is in the center, and then tighten the bolts.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL MANUAL TRANSMISSION UNIT (for Manual Transmission)

s2.ptxt: Align the input shaft with the clutch disc and install the transmission to the engine.
Install the 7 bolts.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION ASSEMBLY (for Automatic Transmission)

s2.ptxt: Install the automatic transmission (See page ).
Install the starter with the 2 bolts.
Install the starter wire to terminal 30 with the nut.
Connect the terminal cap.
Connect the starter connector.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL PROPELLER SHAFT WITH CENTER BEARING

s2.ptxt: Remove SST from the extension housing.
Install the propeller shaft into the extension housing.
Temporarily install the center support bearing with the 2 plates and 2 bolts. Tighten the bolts as much as possible by hand.
Align the matchmarks on the propeller shaft flange and differential flange.
Connect the propeller shaft with the 4 bolts, 4 washers and 4 nuts.

Unload the vehicle. The center line of the center bearing and center bearing housing (see illustration) must be adjusted to within 0 +/-1 mm (0 +/-0.0394 in.) of each other. Measure the difference along the vehicle front/rear axis.
Tighten the 2 bolts of the center support bearing.
Using a vernier caliper, measure the free length of the compression spring.
If the length is less than the minimum, replace the compression spring.
Install the front pipe to the pipe support.
Install a new gasket to the outlet pipe.

atten4.ptxt: Using a plastic-faced hammer, uniformly strike the gasket so that the gasket and exhaust pipe are properly fit.

item.ptxt: Be careful with the installation direction of the gasket.
To ensure a proper seal, do not use the front pipe to force the gasket onto the outlet pipe.

s2.ptxt: Install the front pipe with the 2 compression springs and 2 bolts. Alternately tighten the bolts in several passes.
Install the hood with the 4 bolts.
Connect the washer nozzle hose.
Adjust the hood (See page ).
Install the cowl panel with the 9 bolts.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL WINDSHIELD WIPER MOTOR AND LINK ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Install the wiper motor and link assembly to the vehicle (see page ).
Loosely install the bolt labeled A to install the compressor.
Install the compressor completely by tightening the 4 bolts in the order shown in the illustration.

atten3.ptxt: In order to prevent misalignment, which causes belt rattle, tightening of the bolts must be performed in the order shown.

s2.ptxt: Connect the suction hose with the 2 bolts.
Connect the compressor connector.
Install a new O-ring and the dipstick guide with the bolt.
Install the vane pump with the 2 bolts.
Connect the PS oil pressure switch connector.
Connect the 2 engine room junction block connectors and wire clamp.
Connect the cable to the engine room junction block with the nut.
Install the engine room relay block cover (upper).
Install the engine room relay block cover (side).
Connect the ground wire with the bolt and clamp.
Connect the ground wire to the frame with the bolt so that it is within the range shown in the illustration.
Push the engine wire through the dash panel into the cabin. The wire should be within the range shown in the illustration.
Connect the sensor clamp with the bolt.
Connect the ECM connectors.

s3.ptxt: Connect the 4 ECM connectors.
Install the glove compartment door.

s2.ptxt: Connect the wire clamp to the engine mounting bracket front LH with the bolt.
Connect the No. 2 fuel hose to the pressure regulator.
Connect the No. 1 fuel hose to the pulsation damper.

s3.ptxt: Check that there is no damage or contamination in the connected part of the pipe.

Align the axis of the connector with the axis of the pipe. Push the pipe into the connector until the connector makes a "click" sound. If the connection is tight, apply a small amount of fresh engine oil on the tip of the pipe.
After having finished the connection, try to pull apart the pipe and the connector and confirm that they are securely connected.
Attach the lock claws to the connector by pushing down on the cover, as shown in the illustration.

s2.ptxt: Connect the vacuum hose to the intake manifold.
Connect the hose to the purge VSV.
Install the radiator with the 4 bolts.
Attach the 4 clamps to the radiator side as shown in the illustration.
Connect the 2 front airbag sensor connectors.

s-1.ptxt: CONNECT OIL COOLER INLET HOSE (for Automatic Transmission)

s2.ptxt: Connect the oil cooler inlet hose to the radiator.

s-1.ptxt: CONNECT OIL COOLER OUTLET HOSE (for Automatic Transmission)

s2.ptxt: Connect the oil cooler outlet hose to the radiator.
Install the fan pulley to the water pump.
Place the shroud together with the fluid coupling fan between the radiator and engine.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the radiator core.

s2.ptxt: Install the coupling fan to the water pump with the 4 nuts. Tighten the nuts as much as possible by hand.
Attach the shroud's claws to the radiator as shown in A in the illustration.
Install the shroud with the 2 bolts.
Connect the reservoir hose to the radiator tank upper.
Install the drive belt (see page ).
Tighten the 4 nuts of the fluid coupling fan.
Install the drive belt to the pulleys except the drive belt tensioner pulley.
Use the hexagon-shaped part indicated by the arrow in the illustration to move the tensioner pulley downward and then install the drive belt to the tensioner pulley.

item.ptxt: The backside of the drive belt should face the tensioner pulley.
Check that the drive belt is properly set to each pulley.

s2.ptxt: After a new belt has been installed, check that the tensioner indicator mark is within range A shown in the illustration.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL INTAKE AIR CONNECTOR AND AIR CLEANER ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Install the air cleaner and intake air connector assembly with the 4 bolts, and tighten the hose clamp.
Connect the MAF meter connector and harness clamps.
Connect the No. 2 ventilation hose.
Connect the vacuum hose.

s-1.ptxt: CONNECT CABLE TO NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL

s2.ptxt: Clean and install the oil drain plug with a new gasket.
Add fresh engine oil.

entry.ptxt: Drain and refill with oil filter change
Drain and refill without oil filter change

s2.ptxt: Install the oil filler cap.
Tighten all the plugs and fill the radiator with TOYOTA Super Long Life Coolant (SLLC).

torqueitem.ptxt: for cylinder block drain cock plug

item.ptxt: TOYOTA vehicles are filled with TOYOTA SLLC at the factory. In order to avoid damage to the engine cooling system and other technical problems, only use TOYOTA SLLC or similar high quality ethylene glycol based non-silicate, non-amine, non-nitrite, non-borate coolant with long-life hybrid organic acid technology (coolant with long-life hybrid organic acid technology is a combination of low phosphates and organic acids).
Please contact your TOYOTA dealer for further details.

atten3.ptxt: Never use water as a substitute for engine coolant.

s2.ptxt: Fill the radiator reservoir with TOYOTA SLLC to the F line.
Press the inlet and outlet radiator hoses several times by hand, and then check the level of the coolant.
If the coolant level drops below the F line, add TOYOTA SLLC to the F line.
Install the radiator cap.
Bleed air from the cooling system.

s3.ptxt: Warm up the engine until the thermostat opens.
While the thermostat is open, circulate the coolant for several minutes.
Maintain the engine speed at 2,500 to 3,000 rpm.
Press the inlet and outlet radiator hoses several times by hand to bleed air.

item.ptxt: Be careful as the radiator hoses are hot.
Keep your hands away from the radiator fan.

s2.ptxt: Stop the engine and wait until the coolant cools down to ambient temperature.

atten2.ptxt: Do not remove the radiator cap while the engine and radiator are still hot. Pressurized, hot engine coolant and steam may be released and cause serious burns.

s2.ptxt: Check the coolant level in the radiator reservoir.
If the coolant level is below the L line, add SLLC up to the reservoir F line.

s-1.ptxt: ADD MANUAL TRANSMISSION OIL (for Manual Transmission)
ADD AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION FLUID (for Automatic Transmission)

s2.ptxt: Connect the intelligent tester to the DLC3.

s3.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch ON.
Push the intelligent tester main switch ON.
Select the Active Test and enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Active Test / Control the Fuel Pump / Speed.

s2.ptxt: Check for fuel leaks.

s3.ptxt: Check that there are no fuel leaks after performing maintenance anywhere on the fuel system.

s2.ptxt: Start the engine, and check that there are no oil leaks after performing maintenance.
Check for engine coolant leaks (see page ).
Warm up the engine and stop the engine.

atten3.ptxt: A warmed up engine should have an engine coolant temperature of over 80°C (176°F), have an engine oil temperature of 60°C (140°F), and the engine rpm should be stabilized.

s2.ptxt: When using the intelligent tester:
Check the ignition timing.

s3.ptxt: Connect the intelligent tester to the DLC3.
Start the engine and allow it to idle.
Turn the intelligent tester main switch ON.
Enter the following items: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / IGN Advance.

atten4.ptxt: Refer to the intelligent tester operator's manual for further details.

s2.ptxt: When not using the intelligent tester:
Check the ignition timing.

s3.ptxt: Using SST, connect a tachometer probe to terminal 9 (TAC) of the DLC3.

item.ptxt: Confirm the terminal numbers before connecting them. Connection with a wrong terminal can damage the engine.
Turn off all electrical systems before connecting the terminals.

s3.ptxt: Clamp the tester probe of a timing light to the 4 lead wires or green-red lead wire of the ignition coil connector of the No. 1 cylinder.
Start the engine.
Using SST, connect terminals 13 (TC) and 4 (CG) of the DLC3.

atten3.ptxt: When checking the ignition timing, the transmission should be in the neutral position.

item.ptxt: After connecting the terminals (TC and CG), the engine rpm changes to approximately 1,000 to 1,500 rpm for 5 seconds, then returns to the idle speed. This occurs because the ECM checks that the ISC (idle speed control system) is operating properly.
Perform the inspection of the ignition timing after the engine rpm is returned to idle speed.

s3.ptxt: Using a timing light, measure the ignition timing.
Remove SST from terminals 13 (TC) and 4 (CG) of the DLC3.
Check the ignition timing.
Confirm that the ignition timing moves to the advanced angle side when the engine speed is increased.
Remove the timing light.

s2.ptxt: Warm up and stop the engine.

atten3.ptxt: A warmed up engine should have an engine coolant temperature of over 80°C (176°F), have an engine oil temperature of 60°C (140°F), and the engine rpm should be stabilized.

s2.ptxt: When using the intelligent tester:
Check the idle speed.

s3.ptxt: Connect the intelligent tester to the DLC3.

atten4.ptxt: Refer to the intelligent tester II operator's manual for further details.

s3.ptxt: Start the engine and allow it to idle.
Turn the intelligent tester main switch ON.
Enter the following items: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Data List / Engine SPD.

item.ptxt: When checking the idle speed, the transmission should be in the neutral position.
Switch off all accessories and air conditioning before connecting the intelligent tester.

s2.ptxt: When not using the intelligent tester:
Check the idle speed.

s3.ptxt: Using SST, connect a tachometer tester probe to terminal 9 (TAC) of the DLC3.
Start the engine and allow it to idle.
Check the idle speed.

s2.ptxt: Start and warm up the engine.
Run the engine at 2,500 rpm for approximately 180 seconds and idle the engine.
Insert CO/HC meter testing probe at least 40 cm (1.3 ft.) into the tailpipe.
Check CO/HC concentration at idle.
If the CO/HC concentration is not as specified, perform troubleshooting in the order given below.

s3.ptxt: Check the heated oxygen sensor operation (see page ).
See the table below for possible causes, and then inspect and repair the applicable causes if necessary.

item.ptxt: Plugs are contaminated, shorted or gaps are defective
Leaks in intake and exhaust valves

s2.ptxt: Check the throttle control motor operating sound.

s3.ptxt: Turn the ignition switch ON.
When pressing the accelerator pedal, check the operating sound of the running motor. Make sure that no friction noises emit from the motor.
If friction noise is heard, replace the throttle body.

s2.ptxt: Check the throttle position sensor.

s3.ptxt: Connect the intelligent tester to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch ON.
Under Current Data, check that the throttle valve opening percentage (Throttle Pos) is within the standard.

atten3.ptxt: When checking the standard throttle valve opening percentage, the shift lever should be in the N position.

s3.ptxt: If the percentage is less than 60%, replace the throttle body.

s2.ptxt: Perform initialization (see page ).

atten3.ptxt: Certain systems need to be initialized after disconnecting and reconnecting the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal.
